content: The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" is the short title of the Act. It includes a permanent extension of modifications to the Earned Income Tax Credit. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the maximum amount for joint returns. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the credit amount from $3,000 to $5,000 and make inflation adjustments for the calendar year 2008. A conforming amendment removes paragraph (3) from Section 32(b) of the Code. These amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The Earned Income Tax Credit is being strengthened by increasing the credit amount to $5,000 and making inflation adjustments for the calendar year 2008. This amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. SEC. 6050X requires State, local, or tribal agencies to report data to the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System for individuals in foster care aged 16 and above. The return must include the individual's name, date of birth, and TIN. The return under SEC. 6050X must include individual details and be furnished by January 31 of the following year. Penalties for non-compliance are outlined in section 6724(d)(1) of the Code.
